intro: Polygala myrtifolia var. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes a variety of plants with distinctive floral structures. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
